title: Low elo procrastination. How to make my team haul ass?
body:
One of the biggest issues I am finding so far at lower elo is the stage where:

*- You have a dragon or two*

*- You have destroyed all enemy 1st turrets.*

*- You push mid lane to the inhib turret*

*- Now your team sits there procrastinating and poking away at champs not doing damage on the turret (or very little dmg)*

**.....not realizing that the enemy is just re-gaining HP and buying items (returning stronger) and just waiting for your team to be whittle down enough for a counter-offensive with a shut-down or two.**



I try to encourage the team to redirect their focus to another lane (so that when it comes to base-pushing you can split the enemies defence by hitting 2 inhib turrets)

But it hardly ever works. 
Most players get cocky and sit there until they get shut-down.

Rinse and repeat and a could-be-won game becomes a throw.

**TLDR:**
How the hell do you get 5 random players to work cohesively and focus on logical objectives in one of the most egocentric, younger demographic-filled and toxic games ever created?
Words and pings dont work.
Maybe a GP orange can cure me of this scuuuuurvy.

replies.body:
Back ping * 3 and move away.

Fact is if they can't understand that it's a bad situation, not much you can do to convince them.

If you are sitting mid getting nothing done. Just say, "im leaving, i suggest you guys do too" and go push another lane.
the amount of times I've built a sunfire cape on a support because I have to push a lane as others refuse to is amazing.

I find in lower elos, its easier to ward and get picks than trying to siege for several reasons.

1. no one wards, so no one ever expects to be walking over wards. So if you do, picks can be pretty easy.
2. when sieging, there always seems to be that one guy on the team that dives no matter the situation and blames the team for not following or baits the team into getting aced.
3. situations like you described. getting nothing done and getting poked down.
4. making the game a 4v5 makes the enemy scared to engage on you. free towers. Also if you pick the same person off everytime, they are very likely to rage quit LOL
Hey I'm offended by 1 because I'm bronze and I buy wards in every role

2. Yes agreed it happens a fair bit but NEVER DIVE IF IT'S 5V5 AND THEY HAVE MORE THEN HALF HP EACH, if its 3v5 and you have a **** ton of CC its fine and they are low.
3. Try rotating or pushing out other lanes, and clearing camps and baron etc.
4. Try getting someone to split that can 1v2 and get a kill so you can get tower play and keep your lane pressured but don't pressure to hard.
